intro: Senecio hypotrichus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Senecio hypotrichus produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators.
